content.prompt: Based on the trends shown in the graph, which of the following best describes the populations of Sweden and Mexico at the end of the twentieth century?

choices.label: Both Sweden and Mexico had declining populations.
Mexico’s population was stable, while Sweden’s population was still growing.
Sweden’s population was stable, while Mexico’s population was still growing.
Sweden’s population was growing more rapidly than Mexico’s population.

topic.text: 9.1: Advances in Technology and Exchange after 1900

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
